title: Jalapeno Cheddar Cornbread
subtitle: This cornbread is buttery, fluffy, and has a nice kick of heat! This is a family favorite every Thanksgiving.
subtitle2: The cornbread has jalapenos, green onions, and cheddar inside giving it lots of flavor. The soft crumb makes it melt in the mouth. This cornbread always disappears in a day or 2 whenever I make it.

jalapeno.ingredient: jalapeno (seeded and minced) + 1 whole sliced for garnish

steps: Combine the flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl. In a separate bowl, combine the milk, eggs, and butter.
With a wooden spoon, stir the wet ingredients into the dry until most of the lumps are dissolved. Don't over mix!
Mix in !cheese-inside, scallions, and jalapenos, and allow the mixture to sit at room temp for 20 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 350Â°F. Grease a 9 x 13 x 2 inch baking pan
Pour the batter into the prepared pan, and smooth the top. Sprinkle !cheese-garnish on the top and the sliced jalapeno. Bake for 30 - 35 minutes, or until the toothpick comes out clean.
Cool and cut into large squares. Serve warm or at room temp.
